egl.math

Class Colorf

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<java.lang.Float>
        • egl.math.Vector3
          • egl.math.Colorf
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Float>, java.util.List<java.lang.Float>

    public class Colorf
extends Vector3
    An RGBA color specified using floating point accuracy. This is most useful for operations common in ray-tracing applications, as well as HDR and similar features.
    Author:
    ags, eschweic

    • Constructor Detail

      • Colorf

        public Colorf(float r,
      float g,
      float b)
        The explicit constructor. Values are typically between 0.0 and 1.0.
        Parameters:
        r - The red value.
        g - The green value.
        b - The blue value.

        Copy constructor.
        Parameters:

      • Colorf

        public Colorf()
        Default constructor. Returns black.

    • Method Detail

        Returns:
        The red component.

      • g

        public float g()
        Returns:
        The green component.

        public float b()
        Returns:

      • set

        public Colorf set(Color c)
        Sets this Colorf to be equivalent to a given Color.
        Parameters:

      • clamp

        public void clamp(float min,
         float max)
        Clamps the each component of this color to between [min,max]
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum value
        max - the maximum value

      • gammaCorrect

        public void gammaCorrect(float gamma)
        Gamma corrects this color.
        Parameters:
        gamma - the gamma value to use (2.2 is generally used).

      • toColor

        public Color toColor()
        Returns a Color object. Values are clamped to [0.0, 1.0] before being mapped to [0, 255]. This Colorf object is not modified.
        Returns:
        A Color that corresponds to this Colorf.
